name: Drink & Draw / Imbibe & Inscribe
description:
Unwind from the workweek and flex your creative muscles while enjoying our exclusive Pointless craft beers. 

We will provide the writing and drawing prompts, doodle starters, colored pencils and markers, you provide your awesome self and your desire to relax and have fun.

Fridays, 3-7pm at Pointless Brewery & Theatre. 3014 Packard Road, Ann Arbor.

name: MSAA Ladies Night
description:
Join the fun in Downtown Ann Arbor on Friday, May 13th at this Main Street Area Association hosted event!

ABC is offering a specials on our Ladies Night cocktail list:

Pass that Dutch - Strawberry Blonde & Lemonade.

Get Ur Freak On - Muddled raspberries, blueberries, and mint. Shaken with tequila and sour mix. Served over ice, and topped with ginger beer.

Lose Control (BeerRita) - Cuervo, Euchre Pilsner, Simple Syrup, and Fresh lime juice. 

Sock it to me - Fresh Mint muddled with Bacardi. Topped with hard cider, and Pama Liquor

From 5-9pm retailers roll out the red carpet with special offers, discounts, snacks, goody bags, raffles and more! Participate in our ‘passport’ program during this time and be entered into a drawing to win fabulous prizes!

Pick up a Ladies Night Passport at any of the participating retailers listed on the MSAA website, and receive a stamp for each one you visit. Collect 15 stamps, turn in your passport at any of the participating shops, and be entered to WIN!

http://mainstreetannarbor.org/2016/03/ladies-night-friday-may-13/

name: Fridays After 5
description:
Stop in to UMMA to enjoy special exhibitions, music, and engaging activities at Fridays After 5! With all of UMMA's galleries remaining open until 8:00 p.m., this exciting series provides an interactive atmosphere for all audiences. While you're here, browse the UMMA Store for a wide variety of specialty items. The Museum is always free.

This edition has a free yoga class at 6pm and student docent tours throughout the evening, you won't want to miss it!

name: Ladies Night 2016
description:
Join the fun in Downtown Ann Arbor on Friday, May 13th!

Sales will be offered throughout the day, but from 5-9pm the retailers roll out the red carpet with special offers, discounts, snacks, goody bags, raffles and more! Participate in our ‘passport’ program during this time and be entered into a drawing to win fabulous prizes!

Pick up a Ladies Night Passport at any of the participating retailers listed below, and receive a stamp for each one you visit. Collect 15 stamps, turn in your passport at any of the participating shops, and be entered to WIN!

For a complete list of participating retailers and their Ladies Night specials, please visit www.mainstreetannarbor.org

name: AFC Ann Arbor vs. Kalamazoo FC
description:
After winning the club's inaugural NPSL (National Premier Soccer League) match, 2-1 over the Dayton Dynamo, AFC Ann Arbor returns to action for the second NPSL match of the season. The Mighty Oak play host to Kalamzoo FC on Friday, May 13th at 7pm. Get your tickets in advance and save! 

Online Adult Ticket $8
Online Youth Ticket $5 (Ages 4-12) 
Kids under 4 are FREE 
Tickets at the gate: $10 adult / $6 youth

name: The Neutral Zone Presents: Open Mic Night
description:
Literati is proud to partner with The Neutral Zone to present an Open Mic Night for writers ages 19 and under! We're excited to continue this relationship with a great nonprofit just down Washington Street from us, and to welcome young writers in a safe and welcoming environment for an Open Mic Night!

More about The Neutral Zone:

The mission statement of the center was written by youth and continues to be the voice and heart which drives the center’s creative program and opportunities.

The mission
The Neutral Zone is a diverse, youth-driven teen center dedicated to promoting personal growth through artistic expression, community leadership and the exchange of ideas.

A brief history
In 1998, a group of Ann Arbor teens gathered to discuss the need for a place where teens could congregate after school and on weekends. From the very beginning, they felt this place should be more than just a hangout; that is could be a safe place to make new friends, mix with youth from different backgrounds, explore new ideas, learn new skills and do it all in a setting that was teen friendly and teen driven. Teens wrote the mission statement and the first grant proposal to the Ann Arbor Area Community Foundation and, with seed money in hand, enlisted parents and friends to turn an old brick and timber warehouse into a teen center.

name: Pointless Improv with MATCH and Adultery
description:
These shows are completely improvised, and star an impressive cast of experienced local improvisers, including our resident company The League of Pointless Improvisers.

Group 1: "MATCH" starring Matt Pendrige and Mitch Socia 

Group 2: "Adultery" starring Aaron Johnstone, Nuverre Naami, Lorin Kozlowski

Group 3: "The League of Pointless Improvisers" starring Aaron Johnstone, Corene Ford, Moni Jones, Maggie O'Reilly, Mitch Socia

name: Harmony Bones at Green Wood Coffee House
description: "Harmony Bones" is a quintet of long-time veterans of the Ann Arbor folk music scene. The band consists of Laz Slomovits (of "Gemini") Tom Voiles and Linda Teaman (of "Nutshell"), Jeanne Mackey, and Eric Fithian. Their sound features rich vocal harmonies on traditional, contemporary and original songs, as well as a huge array of folk instruments — guitar, mandolin, flute, pennywhistle, fiddle, accordion, banjo, banjo ukulele, bass, hand percussion — even sitar and Uilleann Pipes! Their collective name, " Harmony Bones," comes from an acupuncture point that harmonizes imbalances and promotes clear thinking, seeing, and hearing!

name: An Atomic Whirl (JAPAN) w/ Sojii, Red Robe & Super Thing
description:
Far House brings you an evening of high energy rock & roll, with a special international touring guest!


An Atomic Whirl (Japan)
http://anatomicwhirl.com/

An Atomic Whirl mixes chaotic noise, sudden soft melodies and mathy arrangements. They also throw in some doom, jazz, shoegaze and other styles they like. Since 2013, they have toured around Asia and across the US.


Local support by:

Sojii (Grand Rapids, MI)
https://sojii.bandcamp.com/

Musical tonic for every dark and ecstatic feeling. Recent import from Brooklyn, NY. 


Red Robe (Ann Arbor, MI)
https://redrobe.bandcamp.com/

Red Robe is a rock band for the modern age, for the 2000-teens. Birthed in August of 2013, this Ann Arbor area trio coalesced with common influences in Nirvana, Can, Shellac, & The Jesus Lizard. Later, a deep commonality arose in wry humor, record collecting, & true cake-eating sound craft. Psychedelic, crystalline guitars. Buoyant, charred bass. Driving, powerful drums. Bittersweet. Joyous. 


Super Thing (Ypsilanti, MI)
https://soundcloud.com/superthing-1

Everyone's favorite post-doom golden boys.


$5 suggested donation for our out-of-town friends.

Doors at 9, with music starting at 10.
SHOW UP ON TIME!

Respect the house and the artists.
This is a music event, not a house party.
Engage and participate.
